subSubSection.paragraph:
Acicula ( Platyla ) wilhelmi (A. J. Wagner, 1910 )
—Pintér, L. & Szigethy, A. 1973: 98, figs 3–4.

Acicula ( Platyla ) wilhelmi ( Wagner, 1910 )
—Gittenberger, E. & Ripken, T.E.J. 1975: 11, fig. 3

Acicula ( Platyla ) wilhelmi (A. J. Wagner, 1910 )
—Zilch, A. 1976: 125, pl. 11 fig. 6.

Platyla wilhelmi ( Wagner, 1910 )
—Boeters, H.D., Gittengerger, E. & Subai, P. 1989: 172, figs 110, 158, 169.

Platyla wilhelmi (A. J. Wagner, 1910 )
—Dhora, D. & Welter-Schultes, F.W. 1996: 107, 176, fig. 43.

Platyla wilhelmi (A. J. Wagner, 1910 )
—Welter-Schultes, F.W. 2012: 83, fig. (unnumbered).

Diagnosis. Shell slender fusiform (H: 3.1–4 mm ), brownish to yellowish, milk-whitish at the neck, with 5¾ to 6 barely convex, almost flat whorls. The body whorl accounts for less than half of the total shell height. Whorls have a weak edge below the suture. Aperture in frontal view narrow drop-shaped, with a deep embayment at the palatal insertion (also present in juvenile shells). Parietal callus well developed, forms a hump at the sinulus. In lateral view, neck bulge flattened but visible, peristome almost vertical, but at the sinulus leaning sharply backwards.

Type material studied.
Lectotype : Montenegro : Kameno bei Castelnuovo [Herceg Novi]; ex. A. J. Wagner ; IZPAN 5478
.
Paralectotypes : 3 shells; same collection data as for lectotype; NHMW 47813 /1, SMF 32565 /2 (designated by
Boeters et al. 1989
)
.

Conservation status. Due to the fact that the number of the known subpopulations is at least 15–20 and there are no identified threats, it was assessed globally as Least Concern ( Fehér 2011c ). In Albania , and also in Montenegro , there are more than five known subpopulations and the areas of occupancy (AOO) are larger than 20 km
2 in
both countries. Hence, this species qualifies as Least Concern at the national level in Albania and also in Montenegro .
